E474EB60DFE60131C13268A86D17958E.description: create art works that show the influence of a particular culture

E4749680DFE60131C13168A86D17958E.description: look at a variety of art works and artifacts from diverse cultures of the United States and identify some distinguishing characteristics

E4744560DFE60131C13068A86D17958E.description: look at and discuss a variety of art works and artifacts from world cultures to discover some important ideas, issues, and events of those cultures

E473FFA0DFE60131C12F68A86D17958E.description: Students will explore art and artifacts from various historical periods and world cultures to discover the roles that art plays in the lives of people of a given time and place and to understand how the time and place influence the visual characteristics of the art work. Students will explore art to understand the social, cultural, and environmental dimensions of human society.

E473BA90DFE60131C12E68A86D17958E.description: discuss how classroom theatre activities relate to their lives

E4736900DFE60131C12D68A86D17958E.description: engage in drama/theatre activities including music, dance, and games which reflect other cultures and ethnic groups

E4731F30DFE60131C12C68A86D17958E.description: dramatize stories and folk tales from various cultures

E472D510DFE60131C12B68A86D17958E.description: Students will gain knowledge about past and present cultures as expressed through theatre. They will interpret how theatre reflects the beliefs, issues, and events of societies past and present.

E4728130DFE60131C12A68A86D17958E.description: identify the primary cultural, geographical, and historical settings for the music they listen to and perform

E4722E00DFE60131C12968A86D17958E.description: identify the titles and composers of well-known examples of classical concert music and blues/jazz selections

E471E690DFE60131C12868A86D17958E.description: identify when listening, and perform from memory, a basic repertoire of folk songs/dances and composed songs from the basic cultures that represent the peoples of the world

E471A2F0DFE60131C12768A86D17958E.description: Students will develop a performing and listening repertoire of music of various genres, styles, and cultures that represent the peoples of the world and their manifestations in the United States. Students will recognize the cultural features of a variety of musical compositions and performances and understand the functions of music within the culture.

E4715EB0DFE60131C12668A86D17958E.description: explain the settings and circumstances in which dance is found in their lives and those of others, both past and present

E47115B0DFE60131C12568A86D17958E.description: identify basic dance movements that are typical of the major world cultures

E470BFA0DFE60131C12468A86D17958E.description: Students will know dances from many cultures and times and recognize their relationship to various cultural, social, and historic contexts. Students will recognize that dance is performed in many different cultural settings and serves many functions in diverse societies.

E4707430DFE60131C12368A86D17958E.description: Students will develop an understanding of the personal and cultural forces that shape artistic communication and how the arts in turn shape the diverse cultures of past and present society.

E4701DA0DFE60131C12268A86D17958E.description: Understanding the Cultural Dimensions and Contributions of the Arts

E46FD240DFE60131C12168A86D17958E.description: explain how ideas, themes, or concepts in the visual arts are expressed in other disciplines (e.g., mathematics, science, literature, social studies, etc.)

E46F8280DFE60131C12068A86D17958E.description: explain the themes that are found in works of visual art and how the art works are related to other forms of art (dance, music, theatre, etc.)

E46F39C0DFE60131C11F68A86D17958E.description: explain the visual and other sensory qualities (surfaces, colors, textures, shape, sizes, volumes) found in a wide variety of art works

E46EDC90DFE60131C11E68A86D17958E.description: explain their reflections about the meanings, purposes, and sources of works of art; describe their responses to the works and the reasons for those responses

E46E9910DFE60131C11D68A86D17958E.description: Students will reflect on, interpret, and evaluate works of art, using the language of art criticism. Students will analyze the visual characteristics of the natural and built environment and explain the social, cultural, psychological, and environmental dimensions of the visual arts. Students will compare the ways in which a variety of ideas, themes, and concepts are expressed through the visual arts with the ways they are expressed in other disciplines.

E46E5630DFE60131C11C68A86D17958E.description: explain the relationship of theatre to film and video

E46E1040DFE60131C11B68A86D17958E.description: identify the use of other art forms in theatre productions

E46DC6B0DFE60131C11A68A86D17958E.description: discuss their understanding, interpretation, and evaluation of a theatrical performance, using basic theatre terminology

E46D7B60DFE60131C11968A86D17958E.description: Students will reflect on, interpret, and evaluate plays and theatrical performances, both live and recorded, using the language of dramatic criticism. Students will analyze the meaning and role of theatre in society. Students will identify ways in which drama/theatre connects to film and video, other arts, and other disciplines.

E46D31F0DFE60131C11868A86D17958E.description: describe their understandings of particular pieces of music and how they relate to their surroundings

E46CE210DFE60131C11768A86D17958E.description: describe the music's context in terms related to its social and psychological functions and settings (e.g., roles of participants, effects of music, uses of music with other events or objects, etc.)

E46C9FF0DFE60131C11668A86D17958E.description: discuss the basic means by which the voice and instruments can alter pitch, loudness, duration, and timbre

E46C5DF0DFE60131C11568A86D17958E.description: describe the music in terms related to basic elements such as melody, rhythm, harmony, dynamics, timbre, form, style, etc.

E46C1B10DFE60131C11468A86D17958E.description: through listening, identify the strengths and weaknesses of specific musical works and performances, including their own and others'

E46BD5C0DFE60131C11368A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate the capacity to listen to and comment on music. They will relate their critical assertions about music to its aesthetic, structural, acoustic, and psychological qualities. Students will use concepts based on the structure of music's content and context to relate music to other broad areas of knowledge. They will use concepts from other disciplines to enhance their understanding of music.

E46B8BF0DFE60131C11268A86D17958E.description: express to others their understanding of specific dance performances, using appropriate language to describe what they have seen and heard

E46B2BF0DFE60131C11168A86D17958E.description: demonstrate knowledge of words and symbols (kinetic, visual, tactile, aural and olfactory) that describe movement

E46AD3F0DFE60131C11068A86D17958E.description: Students will express through written and oral language their understanding, interpretation, and evaluation of dances they see, do, and read about. Students will acquire the critical vocabulary to talk and write about a variety of dance forms.

E46A8180DFE60131C10F68A86D17958E.description: Students will respond critically to a variety of works in the arts, connecting the individual work to other works and to other aspects of human endeavor and thought.

E46A3000DFE60131C10E68A86D17958E.description: Responding to and Analyzing Works of Art

E469C810DFE60131C10D68A86D17958E.description: give examples of adults who make their living in the arts professions

E4697CB0DFE60131C10C68A86D17958E.description: know about some cultural institutions (museums and galleries) and community opportunities (art festivals) for looking at original art and talking to visiting artists, to increase their understanding of art

E4693A50DFE60131C10B68A86D17958E.description: develop skills with electronic media as a means of expressing visual ideas

E468F6E0DFE60131C10A68A86D17958E.description: understand the characteristics of various mediums (two-dimensional, three-dimensional, electronic images) in order to select those that are appropriate for their purposes and intent

E468B040DFE60131C10968A86D17958E.description: Students will know and use a variety of visual arts materials, techniques, and processes. Students will know about resources and opportunities for participation in visual arts in the community (exhibitions, libraries, museums, galleries) and use appropriate materials (art reproductions, slides, print materials, electronic media). Students will be aware of vocational options available in the visual arts.

E46864C0DFE60131C10868A86D17958E.description: speak with theatre professionals about how they prepare for and perform their jobs

E467FA00DFE60131C10768A86D17958E.description: attend theatrical performances in their school and demonstrate appropriate audience behavior

E467A2D0DFE60131C10668A86D17958E.description: use the library/media center of their school or community to find story dramatization material or other theatre-related materials and to view videotapes of performances

E46760C0DFE60131C10568A86D17958E.description: visit theatres, theatre-related facilities, and/or touring companies to observe aspects of theatrical production

E4671D10DFE60131C10468A86D17958E.description: Students will know the basic tools, media, and techniques involved in theatrical production. Students will locate and use school, community, and professional resources for theatre experiences. Students will understand the job opportunities available in all aspects of theatre.

E466D9B0DFE60131C10368A86D17958E.description: discuss ways that music is used by various members of the community

E46693C0DFE60131C10268A86D17958E.description: demonstrate appropriate audience behavior, including attentive listening, in a variety of musical settings in and out of school

E46646C0DFE60131C10168A86D17958E.description: identify the various settings in which they hear music and the various resources that are used to produce music during a typical week; explain why the particular type of music was used

E465E510DFE60131C10068A86D17958E.description: use current technology to manipulate sound

E4659730DFE60131C0FF68A86D17958E.description: construct instruments out of material not commonly used for musical instruments

E46547B0DFE60131C0FE68A86D17958E.description: use classroom and nontraditional instruments in performing and creating music

E464FE10DFE60131C0FD68A86D17958E.description: Students will use traditional instruments, electronic instruments, and a variety of nontraditional sound sources to create and perform music. They will use various resources to expand their knowledge of listening experiences, performance opportunities, and/or information about music. Students will identify opportunities to contribute to their communities' music institutions, including those embedded in other institutions (church choirs, industrial music ensembles, etc.). Students will know the vocations and avocations available to them in music.

E464B750DFE60131C0FC68A86D17958E.description: demonstrate a knowledge of dance-related careers (e.g., dancer, choreographer, composer, lighting designer, historian, teacher)

E4646EB0DFE60131C0FB68A86D17958E.description: understand the concept of live performance and appropriate conduct

E46428F0DFE60131C0FA68A86D17958E.description: demonstrate knowledge of dance resources in video, photography, print, and live performance

E463E5A0DFE60131C0F968A86D17958E.description: Students will know how to access dance and dance-related material from libraries, resource centers, museums, studios, and performance spaces. Students will know various career possibilities in dance and recreational opportunities to dance. Students will attend dance events and participate as appropriate within each setting.

E463A140DFE60131C0F868A86D17958E.description: Students will be knowledgeable about and make use of the materials and resources available for participation in the arts in various roles.

E4635B10DFE60131C0F768A86D17958E.description: Knowing and Using Arts Materials and Resources

E4631260DFE60131C0F668A86D17958E.description: identify and use, in individual and group experiences, some of the roles and means for designing, producing, and exhibiting art works

E462B910DFE60131C0F568A86D17958E.description: reveal through their own art work understanding of how art mediums and techniques influence their creative decisions

E46251D0DFE60131C0F468A86D17958E.description: understand and use the elements and principles of art (line, color, texture, shape) in order to communicate their ideas

E461FAB0DFE60131C0F368A86D17958E.description: develop their own ideas and images through the exploration and creation of art works based on themes, symbols, and events

E461B8E0DFE60131C0F268A86D17958E.description: experiment and create art works, in a variety of mediums (drawing, painting, sculpture, ceramics, printmaking, video, and computer graphics), based on a range of individual and collective experiences

E46173A0DFE60131C0F168A86D17958E.description: Students will make works of art that explore different kinds of subject matter, topics, themes, and metaphors. Students will understand and use sensory elements, organizational principles, and expressive images to communicate their own ideas in works of art. Students will use a variety of art materials, processes, mediums, and techniques, and use appropriate technologies for creating and exhibiting visual art works.

E4612810DFE60131C0F068A86D17958E.description: identify and use in individual and group experiences some of the roles, processes, and actions for performing and creating theatre pieces and improvisational drama

E460DED0DFE60131C0EF68A86D17958E.description: use basic props, simple set pieces, and costume pieces to establish place, time, and character for the participants

E4609DD0DFE60131C0EE68A86D17958E.description: use language, voice, gesture, movement, and observation to express their experiences and communicate ideas and feelings

E4605A70DFE60131C0ED68A86D17958E.description: imitate experiences through pantomime, play making, dramatic play, story dramatization, story telling, and role playing

E46016D0DFE60131C0EC68A86D17958E.description: use creative drama to communicate ideas and feelings

E45FD1B0DFE60131C0EB68A86D17958E.description: Students will create and perform theatre pieces as well as improvisational drama. They will understand and use the basic elements of theatre in their characterizations, improvisations, and play writing. Students will engage in individual and group theatrical and theatre-related tasks, and will describe the various roles and means of creating, performing, and producing theatre.

E45F8410DFE60131C0EA68A86D17958E.description: identify and use, in individual and group experiences, some of the roles, processes, and actions used in performing and composing music of their own and others

E45F3710DFE60131C0E968A86D17958E.description: in performing ensembles, read very easy/easy music (New York State School Music Association [NYSSMA] level I-II) and respond appropriately to the gestures of the conductor

E45EF510DFE60131C0E868A86D17958E.description: read simple standard notation in performance, and follow vocal or keyboard scores in listening

E45EB210DFE60131C0E768A86D17958E.description: sing songs and play instruments, maintaining tone quality, pitch, rhythm, tempo, and dynamics; perform the music expressively; and sing or play simple repeated patterns (ostinatos) with familiar songs, rounds, partner songs, and harmonizing parts

E45E6750DFE60131C0E668A86D17958E.description: create short pieces consisting of sounds from a variety of traditional, electronic, and nontraditional sound sources

E45E1680DFE60131C0E568A86D17958E.description: Students will compose original music and perform music written by others. They will understand and use the basic elements of music in their performances and compositions. Students will engage in individual and group musical and music-related tasks, and will describe the various roles and means of creating, performing, recording, and producing music.

E45DB360DFE60131C0E468A86D17958E.description: create and perform simple dances based on their own movement ideas

E45D6170DFE60131C0E368A86D17958E.description: demonstrate ways of moving in relation to people, objects, and environments in set dance forms

E45D15E0DFE60131C0E268A86D17958E.description: identify and demonstrate movement elements and skills (such as bend, twist, slide, skip, hop)

E45CBAA0DFE60131C0E168A86D17958E.description: Students will perform set dance forms in formal and informal contexts and will improvise, create, and perform dances based on their own movement ideas. They will demonstrate an understanding of choreographic principles, processes, and structures and of the roles of various participants in dance productions.

E45C6D00DFE60131C0E068A86D17958E.description: Students will actively engage in the processes that constitute creation and performance in the arts (dance, music, theatre, and visual arts) and participate in various roles in the arts.

E45C1660DFE60131C0DF68A86D17958E.description: Creating, Performing, and Participating in The Arts
